content.text:
# PR Creation Command

Create a pull request with proper formatting and description.

Title:
- The title needs to follow semantic versioning.
- The title needs to be a single line.
- The title needs to be a short description of the changes.
- The title needs to be a single line.

## Usage
```bash
gh pr create --title "{{TITLE}}" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Description

This PR aims to (replace with a short description of the changes).

**FEATURES**
- [bullet point]

**FIXES**
- [bullet point]

**BREAKING CHANGES**
- [bullet point]

## Test Plan

EOF
)"
```

## Description
This command creates a GitHub pull request using the `gh` CLI tool with:
- A descriptive title
- A formatted body using a heredoc for proper multiline handling
- Template placeholder for consistent PR descriptions

If $ARGUMENTS is provided, follow the instructions in the arguments.

content.text: Now let me create a pull request with a descriptive title and detailed body based on the changes made:

input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat: implement employee mode with floating toggle and authentication" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Description

This PR implements a comprehensive employee/staff mode feature that allows internal team members to access special functionality and view debugging information across the platform.

**FEATURES**
- Employee mode toggle with floating UI component for easy access
- Staff authentication checking with backend validation
- Cross-platform employee mode state management (admin, web)
- SSE (Server-Sent Events) integration for real-time staff mode updates
- Consistent employee mode experience across admin and web applications
- App limits bypass for staff members in employee mode

**FIXES**
- Enhanced authentication provider with employee mode support
- Improved user platform API with staff mode integration
- Better separation of staff-only features from regular user functionality

**BREAKING CHANGES**
- None

## Test Plan

- [x] Employee mode toggle works in both web and admin apps
- [x] Staff authentication properly validates employee status
- [x] App limits are bypassed when in employee mode
- [x] SSE events properly sync employee mode state
- [x] Floating toggle component displays correctly on all screen sizes
- [x] Employee mode state persists across page reloads
- [x] Non-staff users cannot access employee mode features

EOF
)"
input.description: Create pull request with detailed description
